intro: Pancheria gatopensis, commonly known as the Gato Peninsula pancheria, is a flowering plant native to the Gato Peninsula in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Pancheria gatopensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its specific ecological niche.
